metadata.title: Node.js and Server-Side JavaScript
metadata.summary: Introduces Node.js architecture, module systems, streams, and building REST APIs with modern tooling.

references.title: Node.js Documentation
references.author: OpenJS Foundation
references.note: Official docs covering APIs, process model, and best practices.

body: Node.js extends JavaScript to the server using libuv for asynchronous I/O. We examine the module loader, CommonJS versus ES Modules, and package management with npm and pnpm. Streams power efficient data pipelines; examples include file uploads and HTTP proxies.

Building REST APIs involves routing, middleware, and response serialization. We compare Express, Fastify, and native `http` patterns, touching on observability, clustering, and deployment with containers or serverless platforms.
